description: AEO scoring rubric based on 'SEO for AI' (Inbound.no, Oct 2025) PDF analysis. Includes criteria for AI Overviews, conversational tone, freshness signals, and multimedia optimization.

criteria.name: direct_answer
criteria.description: Page provides clear, direct answer in opening paragraph that matches search intent
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No clear answer or answer is buried deep in content. 41-60: Answer present but not prominent or clear. 61-80: Clear answer in first few paragraphs. 81-100: Immediate, comprehensive answer in first 2-3 sentences.
bestPractices: Place the most direct answer in the first 2-3 sentences
Use clear, concise language without jargon
Match the specific search intent (definition, how-to, comparison, etc.)
Include key entities and facts upfront

criteria.name: question_coverage
criteria.description: Page addresses related questions and provides comprehensive coverage of the topic
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Only addresses main topic, no related questions. 41-60: Touches on 1-2 related questions. 61-80: Covers 3-5 related questions well. 81-100: Comprehensive coverage with FAQ section addressing 6+ related questions.
bestPractices: Include an FAQ section with common related questions
Use question-based headings (H2/H3)
Address 'people also ask' type questions
Provide both quick answers and detailed explanations

criteria.name: readability
criteria.description: Content is clear, scannable, and easy to understand with good formatting
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Dense text, no structure, difficult to read. 41-60: Basic structure but could be clearer. 61-80: Well-structured with lists and headings. 81-100: Excellent formatting with short paragraphs, lists, tables, and visual hierarchy.
bestPractices: Use short paragraphs (2-4 sentences)
Include bullet points and numbered lists
Use descriptive headings and subheadings
Add tables for comparisons or data
Maintain 8th-grade reading level or below for broad topics

criteria.name: content_freshness
criteria.description: Page displays clear freshness signals including last updated dates, review timestamps, and recent content updates
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No date information or content appears outdated (>2 years). 41-60: Publication date shown but no update date, or content 1-2 years old. 61-80: Both publication and 'last updated' dates shown, content refreshed within 6-12 months. 81-100: Prominent 'last updated' timestamp within last 3 months, quarterly review cycle documented, edit history visible.
bestPractices: Display 'Last Updated' date prominently near the top of the page
Include both publication date and last modified date in schema markup
Refresh content quarterly for high-priority topics
Add 'Updated for 2025' type notices for evergreen content
Document review cycles (e.g., 'Reviewed quarterly by our team')
Update statistics, examples, and screenshots regularly
Remove or update outdated information and references

criteria.name: conversational_tone
criteria.description: Content uses natural, conversational language that mirrors how people speak and ask questions
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Overly formal, robotic, or academic tone with no conversational elements. 41-60: Mostly formal but includes some natural language. 61-80: Good balance with conversational elements, some contractions, and second-person voice. 81-100: Natural conversational flow throughout, appropriate use of contractions, second-person address, questions to reader, and speech-like patterns.
bestPractices: Use second-person voice ('you' and 'your') to address readers directly
Include contractions naturally (you'll, we're, it's) where appropriate
Ask rhetorical questions to engage readers
Use active voice instead of passive voice
Write how you would explain the topic to a colleague
Avoid overly technical jargon unless necessary (and explain when used)
Include transition phrases that mirror natural speech

criteria.name: snippet_optimization
criteria.description: Content is specifically formatted to be extracted as featured snippets with 40-60 word answers, comparison tables, or step-by-step lists
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No snippet-optimized formats present. 41-60: Some structured content but not snippet-ready (too long/short, poor formatting). 61-80: Contains 1-2 snippet-ready elements (concise answers, tables, or numbered lists). 81-100: Multiple snippet-optimized sections with 40-60 word answers, comparison tables, numbered steps, and bullet lists.
bestPractices: Provide 40-60 word direct answers immediately after question headings
Create comparison tables for 'vs' queries (e.g., X vs Y features)
Use numbered lists for step-by-step instructions
Format definition answers as: '[Term] is [concise definition in 40-60 words]'
Place snippet-worthy content in the first 100-200 words when possible
Use HTML tables for data comparisons (Google favors tables)

Structure answers with

or

tags for clean extraction

criteria.name: eeat_signals
criteria.description: Page demonstrates expertise, authoritativeness, and trustworthiness through author credentials, citations, and trust indicators
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No author info, no citations, no trust signals. 41-60: Basic author info OR some citations. 61-80: Clear author credentials AND multiple citations. 81-100: Expert author with credentials, multiple authoritative citations, and trust indicators (about page, contact info).
bestPractices: Include author bio with relevant credentials
Add publication and last-updated dates
Cite authoritative sources with links
Link to detailed about page and contact information
Show industry certifications or affiliations

criteria.name: outbound_links
criteria.description: Page includes quality outbound links to authoritative sources and references
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No outbound links or only low-quality links. 41-60: 1-2 outbound links to decent sources. 61-80: 3-5 quality outbound links to authoritative sites. 81-100: 6+ outbound links to highly authoritative, relevant sources.
bestPractices: Link to government, academic, or industry-leading sources
Use descriptive anchor text for citations
Include links in context, not just a reference list
Verify all external links are working and HTTPS
Balance internal and external links appropriately

criteria.name: original_research
criteria.description: Page features proprietary data, original studies, surveys, benchmarks, or unique findings that are highly citable
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No original research or data, entirely aggregated content. 41-60: Some unique insights but no formal research or data. 61-80: Contains original data, case studies, or survey results with proper methodology. 81-100: Comprehensive proprietary research with unique datasets, clear methodology, downloadable resources, and citable statistics.
bestPractices: Conduct original surveys or studies relevant to your industry
Publish proprietary benchmarks and performance data
Create unique datasets and make them available (with proper citation request)
Include methodology sections explaining research approach
Add data visualizations (charts, graphs) of original findings
Provide downloadable research reports or whitepapers
Include specific, citable statistics (e.g., 'According to our 2025 survey of 1,000 marketers...')
Update research annually to maintain freshness

criteria.name: performance
criteria.description: Page loads quickly with good Core Web Vitals
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Slow load time (>5s), poor vitals. 41-60: Moderate speed (3-5s). 61-80: Fast load (<3s), decent vitals. 81-100: Excellent performance (<1.5s), all vitals in green.
bestPractices: Optimize images (WebP format, proper sizing)
Minimize JavaScript and CSS
Use browser caching
Implement lazy loading for below-fold content
Achieve LCP <2.5s, FID <100ms, CLS <0.1

criteria.name: indexing
criteria.description: Page is properly indexed with meta tags, canonical URLs, and no indexing issues
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Noindex, missing meta tags, major issues. 41-60: Indexable but missing some meta tags. 61-80: Good meta tags and canonical URL. 81-100: Perfect indexing setup with all meta tags, canonical, HTTPS, mobile-friendly.
bestPractices: Include title tag (50-60 chars) and meta description (150-160 chars)
Set canonical URL correctly
Use HTTPS
Ensure mobile-friendly with proper viewport
Include Open Graph and Twitter Card tags
Submit to Google Search Console

criteria.name: internal_linking
criteria.description: Page has good internal linking structure connecting to related content
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No internal links or orphaned page. 41-60: 1-2 internal links. 61-80: 3-5 contextual internal links. 81-100: 6+ well-placed internal links with descriptive anchors.
bestPractices: Include 5-10 contextual internal links
Use descriptive anchor text (not 'click here')
Link to related articles and pillar content
Ensure proper site navigation and breadcrumbs
Maintain logical information architecture

criteria.name: accessibility
criteria.description: Page is accessible with proper semantic HTML, alt text, and ARIA labels
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Major accessibility issues. 41-60: Some alt text and basic semantics. 61-80: Good accessibility with alt text and semantic HTML. 81-100: Excellent accessibility with WCAG AA compliance.
bestPractices: Use semantic HTML (header, nav, main, article, footer)
Add alt text to all images
Ensure sufficient color contrast
Make interactive elements keyboard accessible
Use ARIA labels where appropriate
Test with screen readers

criteria.name: multimedia_richness
criteria.description: Page includes rich multimedia content such as videos, diagrams, charts, infographics, and visual aids with proper schema markup
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: Text-only content with no visual or multimedia elements. 41-60: Basic images but no videos, charts, or rich media. 61-80: Includes relevant videos OR charts/diagrams with decent presentation. 81-100: Multiple media types (videos with VideoObject schema, charts, diagrams, infographics) that enhance understanding.
bestPractices: Embed short explainer videos (YouTube, Vimeo) with VideoObject schema markup
Include data visualizations (charts, graphs) for statistics and trends
Add process diagrams or flowcharts for complex concepts
Create custom infographics for key takeaways
Ensure all videos have transcripts for accessibility
Use ImageObject schema for key images
Optimize media file sizes for fast loading
Add descriptive captions to all visual elements

criteria.name: schema_markup
criteria.description: Page includes appropriate Schema.org structured data markup
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No schema markup. 41-60: Basic schema (Article or WebPage). 61-80: Multiple schema types including FAQ or HowTo. 81-100: Comprehensive schema with nested entities and all relevant types.
bestPractices: Implement Article schema with author, datePublished, dateModified
Add FAQPage schema for Q&A sections
Include HowTo schema for step-by-step guides
Add BreadcrumbList schema for navigation
Use Organization schema with logo and social links
Validate with Google's Rich Results Test
Consider Product, Review, or Event schema where applicable

criteria.name: entity_clarity
criteria.description: Page provides clear, structured definitions of key entities (people, organizations, products, concepts) with explicit relationships
criteria.scoringGuidance: 0-40: No clear entity definitions or structure. 41-60: Entities mentioned but not explicitly defined. 61-80: Key entities defined with basic context and relationships. 81-100: All major entities clearly defined with structured format, schema markup, and explicit relationships.
bestPractices: Define key terms and entities explicitly (e.g., 'X is a [category] that [function]')
Use DefinedTerm schema for glossary items
Structure entity relationships clearly (e.g., 'Company X, founded by Person Y')
Include entity attributes (founded date, location, parent organization)
Create knowledge panel-worthy entity descriptions
Link entities to authoritative sources (Wikipedia, official sites)
Use consistent entity names throughout the page
Add Person or Organization schema for key entities

homepage.description: Homepage scoring emphasizes brand trust, navigation, and overview content

blog.description: Blog post scoring emphasizes content quality, E-A-T, and comprehensive answers optimized for AI search

product.description: Product page scoring emphasizes clear value proposition, specifications, and conversion elements

solution.description: Solution page scoring emphasizes problem-solution fit and comprehensive explanation

resource.description: Resource page scoring emphasizes depth, citations, comprehensive coverage, and unique insights

conversion.description: Conversion page scoring emphasizes clarity, trust signals, and technical performance

notes: This rubric is based on 'SEO for AI' PDF (Inbound.no, October 2025) analysis and industry best practices
Version 1.1 adds 6 new criteria: content_freshness, conversational_tone, snippet_optimization, multimedia_richness, original_research, entity_clarity
New criteria prioritize AI Overviews visibility, featured snippet optimization, and conversational content
For additional AEO guides, place PDFs in server/data/aeo-guides/ and process via the processAeoGuide function
Processed principles will be saved to server/data/aeo-principles/ with timestamps
Key insights: Fresh content (quarterly updates), conversational tone, 40-60 word snippet answers, proprietary research are highly citable
